title: Midcap banking stocks gain up to 7% on attractive valuations, rate cut hopes
content:
NEW DELHI: Shares of midcap banks notched up significant gains in Wednesday's trade amid hope of an interest rate cut in the forthcoming money policy review and as investors found some of the counters attractive after the recent correction. 

The midcap banking stocks gained up to 7 per cent compared with a 0.5 per cent fall in the BSE bankex, even as equity benchmark Sensex shed 0.3 per cent. 

Shares of IDBI Bank rallied over 7 per cent while Uco Bank surged 5 per cent. Syndicate Bank gained 3.5 per cent, while Canara Bank and Karnataka Bank added 2.5 per cent each. 

After the status quo on rate hike by the US Fed, investors are now eyeing Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) forthcoming policy meet scheduled for September 29, hoping that RBI governor Raghuram Rajan will please the Street with another repo rate cut. 

At the end of the two-day FOMC meeting that ended on September 17, the US Fed announced its decision to leave the rates unchanged at 0-0.25 per cent, keeping the rates unchanged for the seventh year or 55th straight FOMC meeting. 

"I don't think RBI will be in a big hurry. If you look at the last two inflation readings, they have undershot the revised trajectory that RBI had put out in its previous policy document. So given that RBI is an inflation targeter, a 30-35 bps undershoot to its trajectory should open up room for a 25 bps cut. But I will be surprised if it does more than that, given the fact that it continues to see inflation going down towards five," said Suyash Choudhary of IDFC MF.
